heisig_chinese_memo: Pandas like to eat bamboo. I'm using panda as the primitive name when it fits the story. ^__^.
heisig_story: Bamboo grows upwards, like a straight nail, and at each stage of its growth (which legend associates with the arrival of the new moon) there is a jointed rootstock (the first stroke). Two such bamboo stalks are pictured here.
koohiiStory1: Pandas like to eat bamboo. I¬¥m using panda as the primitive name when it fits the story. ^__^.
koohiiStory2: Two reclining victims impaled on bamboo spheres...„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄRTK2:„ÄÄ„ÉÅ„ÇØ„ÄÄÊùæÁ´πÊ¢Ö„ÄÄ„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„Å°„Åè„Å∞„ÅÑ(pine, bamboo, plum).

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The bamboo radical and the bamboo kanji are exactly the same!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Just make sure you know your radicals!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: There's a little bamboo shrub sitting there, holding onto a lollipop. Because you're bigger than the bamboo shrub, you just take („Åü„Åë) it from the bamboo, causing it to cry.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Of course, focus on the absurdity of a bamboo shrub that can cry and eat a lollipop. Also, think about how mean you are to take the lollipop away from a defenseless bamboo shrub in the first place!
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Pandas like to eat bamboo. I'm using panda as the primitive name when it fits the story. ^__^.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The represent of a village is reading a written prayer to God in the early 20th century The character Á¨¨ (di, auxiliary word for ordinal numbers) is also from this character under the same logic. The top of this character means bamboo (Á´π), the material of spear, and below is the rope which winds the spear. For example, Á¨¨‰∏Ä (di yi) means ‚Äòthe first‚Äô (the first rope of the spear), Á¨¨‰∫å (di er) means ‚Äòthe second‚Äô.
humanum_full_description_en:
There are two forms of oracle bone and the inscription " bamboo ". The oracle-bone inscriptions are like two bamboo branches connected with the leaves drooping, similar to the bamboo method of traditional Chinese painting; or like two separate bamboo branches with leaves. The original meaning is bamboo.

As for the inscriptions, the early clan emblem " bamboo " is like two small branches connected with bamboo leaves hanging down. Later, the " bamboo " shape was divided into two branches with leaves.

Inscription: "The king uses bamboo if" ("B" 6350), which is the original meaning of bamboo; it is also used as surname, personal name, place name and country name. For example, Guzhu was one of the vassal states of the Shang Dynasty, and it was in conjunction with the oracle bone inscription "Zhuhou", located to the north of Yanshan (oracle bone inscriptions). Bronze inscriptions are often used as names and clan emblems, such as Father Ding Guzhu Lei: "Father Ding Guzhu", and riding horse festival: "Riding Zhuhou".

Note: Scholars do not have a consensus on the interpretation of the first typeface in the oracle bone inscriptions , or consider it as " bamboo " (such as Guo Moruo, Li Xiaoding, and Yao Xiaosui ), or think that it is "ÂÜÑ" (such as Shang Chengzuo, Zhu Fangpu , Sun Haibo, Xu Zhongshu, etc.). The two statements cannot coexist. The former is the pictogram of the plant bamboo, and the latter is the long beard on the cheeks of a person, that is, the beard. Who is right and who is wrong is still to be tested.
humanum_short_description_en: There are two forms of oracle bone and the inscription " bamboo ". The oracle-bone inscriptions are like two bamboo branches connected with the leaves drooping, similar to the bamboo method of traditional Chinese painting; or like two separate bamboo branches with leaves. The original meaning is bamboo.

    There are two forms of oracle bone and the inscription " bamboo". The oracle-bone inscriptions are like two bamboo branches connected with the leaves drooping, similar to the bamboo method of traditional Chinese painting; or like two separate bamboo branches with leaves. The original meaning is bamboo. As for the inscriptions, the early clan emblem " bamboo" is like two small branches connected with bamboo leaves hanging down. Later, the " bamboo" shape was divided into two branches with leaves. Inscription: "The king uses bamboo if" ("B" 6350), which is the original meaning of bamboo; it is also used as surname, personal name, place name and country name. For example, Guzhu was one of the vassal states of the Shang Dynasty, and it was in conjunction with the oracle bone inscription "Zhuhou", located to the north of Yanshan (oracle bone inscriptions). Bronze inscriptions are often used as names and clan emblems, such as Father Ding Guzhu Lei: "Father Ding Guzhu", and riding horse festival: "Riding Zhuhou". Note: Scholars do not have a consensus on the interpretation of the first typeface in the oracle bone inscriptions, or consider it as " bamboo" (such as Guo Moruo, Li Xiaoding, and Yao Xiaosui), or think that it is " ÂÜÑ" (such as Shang Chengzuo, Zhu Fangpu , Sun Haibo, Xu Zhongshu, etc.). The two statements cannot coexist. The former is the pictogram of the plant bamboo, and the latter is the long beard on the cheeks of a person, that is, the beard. Who is right and who is wrong is still to be tested.

    bamboo
    Basic explanation of words
    bamboo
    zh√∫
    Evergreen perennials, shoot shoots in spring, the stem has many nodes, the middle is empty, the texture is hard, and there are many types. It can be used to make utensils, and it can also be used as a building material: bamboo. Bamboo leaves. Bamboo shoots. Bamboo weaving (crafts made with bamboo strips). bamboo carving.
    Refers to bamboo wind instruments: Jinshisizhu.
    One of the ancient Chinese musical instrument octave.
    name.
    bamboo
    Chinese dictionary definition of words
    [‚ë†]Ôºªzh√∫ÔºΩ
    ["Guangyun" Zhang Liuqie, enter the house, know. ]
    (1) A perennial woody evergreen plant of the family Gramineae. The young shoots are bamboo shoots, which are edible; the stems are cylindrical, hollow, straight and knotted, and tough. They can be used as building materials and making various utensils. The leaves are evergreen throughout the seasons and will not wither through winter.
    (2) Refers to bamboo slips.
    (3) One of the eight sounds of ancient music. Refers to bamboo wind instruments, xiaoguanshengdi and the like.
    (4) Last name. There was Zhu Yan in the Han Dynasty. See "Tongzhi¬∑Clan Two".
